description:
Great place to try Indian/Pakistani plates!

I was able to try this place out due to my friend's recommendation and it was great! 

We ordered tandoori chicken leg, lamb biryani, seek kabob, and chicken tikka massala! All of the plates were very flavorful and juicy. For the service, you need to grab all your plates, napkins, water, and utensils yourselves, but that wasn't a problem for me at all! The portions were large, especially for the lamb biryani.
author: Justyn P.

description:
A bit upset.  I took some friends who were visiting here for dinner.  They gave us paneer tikka masala instead of butter chicken, then told us they would redo it, and asked if chicken tikka masala was okay.  I said I wanted butter chicken, the guy straight up lied to my face and told me butter chicken (makhani) and tikka masala were the same thing.  I know they aren't, I go to your restaurant twice a week.  I know what the hell butter chicken is, and it's not tikka masala.

Also, our 5 garlic naans were all missing garlic.

Please do better next time.  I know you just took the paneer out of the tikka masala and put in chicken, instead of wanting to cook a whole new makhani.
author: Bryan H.

description:
Beef seekh Kabob and Garlic Naan - A1!!!!
Nihari - good, but shalimar is better 
CTM - average and a bit sweet which was weird to me 
The side of onion, kalongi, jalepenos, and chaat masala was a cherry on top! I believe it comes with the meal, but I'm not sure. 
Not a fan of self service, but food is great overall!
author: Sarah R.

description: Yummy Pakistani food. The Sausage Kababs are surprisingly spicy but in a good way. The Tandoori Chicken was very juicy. We came by for quick snack of all protein and it more than satisfied our needs. Their service is friendly and they're funny.
author: Jen L.

description:
Order in the front, get a number, they will call you, you pick up your food, utensils, water cups to ur own table. Very simple, efficient way to eat. Food was good, got the tikka masala to share between 2 with rice and naan and it was enough. Asked for extra spicy and they almost did it right, it was prob a 7/10 spicy. Good enough! 

Chai tea is $1, wished it was free like most places.
author: Debbie D.

description:
We been walking all day and my buddy wanted something like home cooking. So we walked in and got a seat. My buddy ordered the butter chicken and the chicken kabob as well as two orders of naan. We picked up our order and started on our little feast. Personally if the chicken was simmering with the curry it'll taste like so much better but since it was cooked together then that dish was just bland even though the chicken was tender. The kabob was also bland but I fixed that by dousing it with chimichurri that green sauce. As for the naan it's was fluffy and soft. I would of preferred the garlic naan but I didn't ask for it. 

The place was clean and dim but it was comfy.
author: Tim E.

description:
I always try and come here EVERYTIME I come to San Francisco. My friend that used to live here showed me this spot and it's probably one of my favorite spots in the city. 

FOOD ORDERED:
CHICKEN MAHKANWALA: this was the buttered chicken which was my first time having. I thought it was quite tasty. Great taste and lots of sauce in this dish. 
CHICKEN ACHAR: this has always been my go to dish whenever I come here. Has a perfect amount of spicyness to it which I absolutely love. Had peppers and chilis inside too. If you like spicy, I recommend this hands down!!
GARLIC NAN: This is a definite must when you come here. Pairs with the chicken perfectly and has great taste! 
BASMATI RICE: Huge serving of rice enough for 2-3 people. Perfectly cooked. I also recommend getting the green sauce in the fridge. It's pretty tasty and has a little spice to it as well. 

SERVICE:
Service was super easy. It is pretty much self serve for water and sauce. It's always busy during night time so I recommend getting there a little earlier. The guys at the register were pretty nice as well. They do have a TV but they only play YouTube videos from it. Sucks but it's whatever. 

BONUS: this place is a BYOB spot which makes it even better! Bring anything you want! It's awesome! Can't wait to come back here.
author: Peter H.

description:
The food here is really good. If I lived in the neighborhood, they'd def be my go-to place when I'm craving bomb Indian/paki food! The guy who took my order was super nice and helpful. They're reasonably priced as well! 
Ordered the following things:
Chicken biryani - well made, enough chicken and really good flavor! 
Samosa - stuffing was good and samosas were crispy.
Beef kabob, butter chicken and tandoori chicken - the seasoning was on point and curry was yum. 
Daal makhni - they def skipped the makhan (butter) on the daal, but I prefer it that way. My husband felt it wasn't "real daal makhani"

So all in all - absolutely worth going here for lunch or dinner.
author: Nikita G.

description: I only leave ratings for restaurants that I would definitely come back to. You can read the gazillion other reviews already on Yelp.
author: Meems N.

description: Dope Indian spot. Doesn't seem like any food safety risk to me. Good chai, good authentic subjhi, good naan served fast. What else could one want? Probably the best Indian place all around in SF.
author: Aakash G.

description: BYOB and bombass Indian food! I'm biased cause I simply rank curries are my #1 food type! Had the saag paneer and chicken Tikka masala- the saag paneer was waayy better! Will definitely go back. Special props to GF to bringing me here!
author: James L.

description:
One of my favorite Indian/Pakistani restaurants in San Francisco. Don't let the food safety score scare you too much - this place serves up authentic flavors at a fair price in the Mission.

I'd recommend trying out the Chicken Achar, the Lamb Biryani, and garlic naan.

Don't expect too much of this place in terms of cleanliness, quietness, and ambiance. You go here for the tasty food, and that's about it.

Oh, and be sure to bring some beer or wine, it's byob! If you forget, there's a convenience store right across the street to pick something up.
author: Kedar V.

description:
How do you impregnate a watermelon?
.
.
.
.
You Pakwan.

OK, not everyone will get this joke because it's a "dirty" Filipino joke. The word for watermelon in Tagalog is "Pakwan" and you know how Filipinos pronounces "F's" as "P's," right? That's basically the joke in a nutshell. 

But this place is no joke as they serve classic, solid and delicious Indian & Pakistani food. There are three locations in San Francisco and two more in the East Bay. I believe (I could be wrong) that this is the fist location in SF.

When I first knew of this place, I assumed it was a vegetarian restaurant because of the name. But I was half correct since they also serve wonderful vegetarian dishes. We finally got to eat here last year with some old co-workers and ordered Chicken Tandoori, Basmati Rice, Garlic Naan Bread, Saag Paneer, Chicken Tika Masala and Lamb Curry. Everything was solid, flavorful and familiar, just like the company. 

The good thing about this location is that it's also close to the BART Station on Mission St., which I would recommend since finding parking here is a nightmare. 

To sum it up:

Good food.
Good service.
Good and chill vibes.
author: John G.

description:
Concept: Order at the counter and receive a number. Find a seat (hopefully you are not here at prime time) and gather your plates and cutlery by the front door. Make sure you snag a bottle of water for the table located in the mini fridge. Wait for your number to project onto the tv screen and pick up at the counter. 

A couple of must haves: Veggie Biryani and Garlic Naan FOR SURE. I also love the Chana Masala and Daal dishes. The Lamb curry is scrumptious too.

Tip: BYOB. No cork fee! They even supply a cork screw if you forget yours. This locations food is better than the one on Ocean Ave. Great place for take out.

Negatives: It's very loud and busy in here during dinner time.
author: Adriana G.

description: Major love this place.. it is one of those places you want to share with the world because they do food right. It is super reasonable with the prices.. and the taste is amazing.. reminds me of the streets of delhi. I love you!!!
author: Neha B.

description:
There are times when the Indian food craving is real. For those times, you've got Pakwan! Located in the Mission, conveniently near a BART station, there's plenty of room for everyone. I'm always surprised as the how much seating restaurants manage to fit while still maintaining inexpensive prices. Business must be popping!

Most people coming to Pakwan seem to be regulars who know what they want. They just went up the cashier and ordered, or they had called in for take-away. Instead, I grabbed a menu from the counter and my eyes quickly scanned for any sign of a lamb curry. Ah, yes. Achar Gosht is what I was looking for.

My friend and I took our "buzzers" and found seats in the back of the restaurant. Eventually we were summoned to pick up our food. The curry was piping hot and extra spicy, as the menu indicates. Went perfectly with the garlic naan. There was more fat on the lamb than I'd like, but it was still filling.

Overall this was a solid place, and it doesn't require going too far out of the way. Plan to pop over for a drink next door at ABV like we did, and you have a great idea for a fun night out!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Came here for a late night dinner and got the regular and Garlic Naan with (chicken) Tikka Masala and Achar Gosht (a delightfully spicy lamb curry).

There wasn't much of a wait time although the restaurant half full at around 10pm. Sitting inside the restaurant, I felt like I wasn't in SF anymore, which was a nice reprieve and made me feel like I was on vacation. It was also nice that the restaurant was spaced out enough between tables that the noise level wasn't outrageously loud. The smell of spices while sitting inside the restaurant really did whet the appetite.

I'm sure the restaurant makes fairly authentic Pakistani/Indian dishes, but I found the naan and chicken tikka masala to be a bit too dry to my liking (or maybe I'm used to a more Americanized version of both?). I liked the smoky flavor that was in the tikka masala, I had never had a tikka masala flavored quite like that and wonder if it's the Pakistani take on the traditionally Indian dish. The garlic naan was nice and subtly flavored, as I'm not a huge fan of strong garlic flavors. The Achar Gosht

Overall, I would come back here for the atmosphere and would like to try other curries and rice dishes here! Just wished the chicken was more moist and tender!
author: Victoria W.

description:
Vet lokal! Nice to try! Love nan and many favor curry. 
Love veggies too. Quick dinner for the fast food
author: Jennifer L.

description: Pakhwan is the perfect place for hanging out as a group, given you are pretty loud, otherwise you can't communicate with each other. It's located in a pretty busy, happening street. The atmosphere is pretty busy. The boti kabobs are pretty soft and tender: a little salty though. Garlic naans are amazing and they have a good variety of vegetarian curry options too. Loved it and would definitely recommend it.
author: Sriganesh N.

description:
** 3.5 stars **  

I ordered butter chicken with naan and samosas.  The chicken was slightly dry, but it was soaked in the sauce so all was good.  The butter chicken had a slight kick in it.  I am one of those people that doesn't do spicy.  I liked the samosas, but it wasn't served with any sauce.  I was disappointed to find out if you want sauce you have to get it out of the fridge yourself.  No one told me, only observed after I had finished eating, too late.  Service is fair.  The TV will tell you when it's your turn to pick up food.  Prices are reasonable. Parking is tough.
author: Andrea B.

description:
Vegetarian items sucks!
We tried paneer tikka masala and it was more like a tomato puree. Worst paneer tikka we've far.
author: Shailee A.

description:
BYOB Indian/Pakistani spot in the Mission. A few things to note:

- Liquor store across the street
- The spicy dishes are very spicy
- Grab a water from the fridge on the left when you enter
- Reasonable prices and big portions
- It's grimy but loveable
author: Nick K.

description:
Pakwan is so damn good.
BYOB fro the liquor store across the street. My favorite dishes are the achar gosht, tandori fish, and saag paneer.
author: Huey N.

description: Achari gosht and tandoori chicken boti are highly recommended. In vegetarian section I have enjoyed saag paneer and daal. Friendly service at the counter.
author: Nona H.

description:
I parked several blocks away and still had to get to this restaurant.

Luckily, when I got there, I was able to go right to the cashier to order. I ordered the Lamb Biryani and the cashier asked, do you want some naan? At first, I didn't think that I should order more carbs, but I did not want to miss out on trying how they make their naan. I went to gather some utensils, napkins, bottle of water, empty glass, and then found a table. I had just beat the crowd, because when I turned around, there was a line of people at the cashier trying to order. The cook yelled out my number, so I went to pick up my food at the counter. Wow, I had ordered too much food. But I was glad that I got the naan because it was crispy and warm. The biryani was tasty and mildly spicy, another reason to get the naan with it. Maybe the cashier was hinting that I had better get that naan or just burn. Also the lamb was tender and not dry. Had to get 2 take out boxes and 2 bags to hold all the food after I finished eating!

I'll be back.
author: GARY C.

description:
I've been to the O'Farrell location a couple times in the past couple years, but had I known about this spacious location, I would have come here before! 

My family arrived here around 9:45 pm on a Saturday night...and this place was poppin' 
Youngsters were sitting with their food on the tables outside, families with their young kids on the inside, and a couple others of different ethnicities enjoying their food. 

We took a moment to glance over the menu and decided on chicken karahi, regular/garlic naan, mango lassi, chicken tikka boti, beef seekh, and Kheer for dessert. 

When I go to Pakwan, I go with this high expectation of SOLID AUTHENTIC Pakistani cuisine...and this time I was NOT disappointed. 

All the food was delicious, the chicken tikka boti was tender, the chicken karahi was slightly spicy but flavorful,  the mango lassi was thick & not watered down, and the GARLIC naan was round and crisp. The beef seekh was pretty much gone by the time I made a grab for it, so that right there should tell you something.
author: Anum W.

description:
So this is where all the good restaurants are located, hidden in the Mission/Castro area and away from the crazy Market Street!

The Indian food here was delicious! You order food at the counter and get a number, and help yourself to utensils, plates, sauces and water. They call your number and your food comes out shortly after!

I had the chicken biriyani and it was delicious! It was packed full of flavor and spices, and was a bit spicy but otherwise delicious! The chicken was also a little dry in some spots but that can be overlooked based on how good everything else was.

The raita could also be a bit better too, it was a little boring. The other two sauces though were great.

Overall a good spot and it opened my eyes to food beyond Market Street.
author: Tyler T.

description:
The worst thing someone could do would be to tell me exactly how much I spend here at the end of a year. Ain't no shame - I order from here from a few times a week. Always get take-out, always satisfied. 

Chicken tikka masala is stupid, like in a really good way. If I could order buckets of the sauce alone I would.  Saag paneer - whatever they do to make their paneer chewy firm but not dry, I love it. Their rice is perfect and has delicious seedy little spice bits. This is a strong-flavored spot, so put your big tastebud pants on. 

I would like to see them move towards more eco-friendly packaging. They use so much plastic and include containers of sauces, even if asked to forgo. 

Probably not healthy to eat here so much.  Anything craved so strongly can't be good for me, right? But, Pakwan was the single most craved SF food item when I was recently away for a few months. One of my top picks in SF (seriously).
author: Jenna S.

description:
Pretty disappinting. My party ordered the pakora, rice, daal, saag paneer, paneer makhani and karahi chicken - with naan. 
The naan was good, and the rice was okay. The chicken was really great and tender but everything else was just... eh. The paneer makhani tasted like basic tomato soup over paneer, and the saag was so underspiced. The daal was okay. It's frustrating paying good money for something you could have cooked better yourself.
author: Poppy C.

description:
One of the more authentic Indian/Pakistani restaurants in the city! 

Chicken Makhanwala: Also known as butter chicken, rich gravy. 

Chicken Achar: Spicy and good portions of meat.

Chicken Biryani: The caramelized onions were a boon. Great meat quantity.

Even the (free) onions we requested along with the food had chaat masala. Nice guys here, will visit again!
author: Dhruvil B.

description:
Slammin' Pakistani food at fair prices and open late.

Takeout is *fast* and easy! Call in ahead and food is usually ready by the time you get there.

Also, great options for Keto and low carb diets:
Saag Paneer and Paneer Makhani are pretty much Keto lifesavers for me.
author: Nick S.

description: This is probably one of my favorite Indian food places in Mission. Their baingan bharta and saag paneer are great. My favorite part though is the 1$ chai. The rates are very affordable. Although I suggest taking the Bart here. It's very close to the Bart station so probably worth it instead of trying to find parking space.
author: Sonal B.

description:
Solid Pakistani/Indian food for a reasonable price with friendly staff. We tried quite a few dishes and while none were necessarily breathtaking, they were all very good and filling. The garlic naan was nice and fluffy. The chai was pretty good as well. 

All in all, a solid spot but I hope you don't plan on driving, or if you do, expect to loop around for 10-15min to find a spot.
author: Mario B.

description: Spice level suits my taste. Great service -- first time visiting I forgot my mango lassi, and they let me take one free of charge on my second visit. My go-to for hearty Indian cuisine
author: Alvina E A.

description:
Wow, super homey and non-pretentious Pakistani restaurant with a straightforward menu and really reasonable prices and portions! And apparently you can BYOB from the liquor store across the street. :)

Me, Kathie, and Kristen were drawn in by the wonderful smell of the food ... complete impulse decision. No ragrets. And even though we walked in at around 4pm on New Years, the restaurant was still pretty busy with a line. 

You order at the counter, take a number, and find your own table and they bring you your food. It's awesome.

Kristen and I both got $3 mango lassis (pre-prepared in the fridge, awesome) and Kathie got the $1 chai that comes with unlimited refills from their huge jug of chai. The chai was ok, not much flavor and feels really powder-milky. Makes sense that it's $1. We also shared a Achar Gosht, which is labelled as "extra spicy" but it really wasn't that spicy. It was a nice, soupy dish with tender chunks of lamb. We paired it with the garlic naan which was SO FRESH AND GARLICKY AND WARM ugh, delicious. I think the rice would have paired better, though.

We were so glad we came in, and I know Kristen (who actually lives in SF) will be back. She went home raving to her roommates.
author: Yenny Z.

description: Went on a Saturday around 6pm and the place was pretty full, which was a good sign because I've never gone here before and from the look of it, everyone was enjoying their food. Their menu is pretty standard for a Pakistani restaurant (it's very much like Indian food) and the prices are decent. We got 5 dishes with naan for 4 adults and 1 child, which was the perfect amount! Didn't even have to order rice because the biryani tasted really good with the other meats. I would recommend the butter chicken and the beef! Those were my favorite. And the garlic naan was bomb too. I also got a mango lassi which was creamy and delicious. I was worried we wouldn't be able to find a table because it was very crowded, but we were able to snatch one right as a group of people were leaving. Definitely a must if you're in the area!
author: Allison D.

description: We came here during a move to the city. We walked in around 12 and the restaurant  had a few people in it. The guy who rang us up was super patient with our order and very accommodating. The food came out in 10mins! And it was very fresh and flavorful. The chicken tikka masala was melt in your mouth. We left around 1 (on a Sunday) and it was packed! So arrive around 12 or before if you want to beat the rush. I will definitely be coming back when I'm in the mission!
author: Rocky H.

description: This is definitely one of the better Indian/Pakistani restaurants in the city. Their kebabs are delicious and, even though I'm not the biggest fan of lentils, the daal and the spinach daal dishes are so tasty with the naan.
author: Foofa B.

description:
This is my favorite place to get some seekh kebab! Of course, get beef or don't get anything, it's the best!! 
The garlic naan is delicious when warm, so don't get it to go unless you live close by (like me). 
The service is nice and very friendly!
author: Muhammad U.

description: this is one of the "most popular" Indian restaurants in town? This is disappointing and disgusting. Spent hours to pick up the clean ones. I believe they never wash them. 200% turn off. No 2nd time. I couldn't believe that no one cared about this "little thing", all the people inside the restaurant enjoyed their meals... oh, my...
author: Giungie P.

description:
Solid Indian food. 

Order in the front, seat yourself and they'll call you when the food is done. I got the saag paneer - good, nothing to write home about, but it was good! 

Convenient (since it's close to bart and some great bars) which makes it a great place to go!
author: Nina Y.

description:
[lunch] 

Awesome curry! I came here for lunch and split a chicken and lamb curry with a friend. We also ordered the garlic and potato naan. The potato naan was definitely the highlight. The lamb curry was a little oily, but definitely enjoyed the chicken curry more. It was very well seasoned with spices and amazing flavor! They are also very generous on the chicken pieces. It's the not the cheapest Indian food, but the quality was definitely better than what I've had. 

The only downside here is that they charge one dollar for chai. Otherwise, definitely worth coming to watch some Bollywood movies and enjoying a nice lunch.
author: Alice Z.

description:
Good kebabs.

But rest of the stuff is cold. You can see water different in Saag or Lamp. It seems like everything here is refrigerated and they just warm it up before serving. 

Won't visit again
author: Qasim Z.

description: Delicious food. Very flavorful. Had paneer makhani with naan, chicken leg, and veg biryani. Highly recommend it.
author: Prateek J.

description: Pakwan is hands down the best Indian food I have tasted in the city.   I judge Indian food by the flavor taste. Chicken Achari is my favorite its really spicy and flavorful.  Biryani (Lamb/Chicken) are my best so far in west coast.  Their food is never geasy or oily and it never smells. So fresh. Keep up the good work and the place gets packed in the evenings, so plan accordingly.
author: Hiten P.

description:
My to go place. Everything in pakwan is soooo good. I will not say it's authentic paki/indi but it's definitely very good. The best thing about them is that they use their own spices. And use hand slaughtered halal chicken. 
I've tried all of their dishes but these (hands down) their best:
- lamb baryani 
- malai tikka boti
- seekh kebab
- saag paneer (spinach cheese) 
-  Channay (garbanzo beans)  
- Samosay 
- Haleem (they occasionally make it and it's so damn good) 

All the chicken tikka masala lovers - please try something else (no offense )
author: Sumbal A.

description: This place is the bomb! The garlic naan is out of this world. Quick and easy. Friendly staff. It's also bring your own beer which is cool, there is a liquor store across the street!
author: Emily H.

description:
This restaurant is a no frills place with simple but good authentic food. Thoughts on lunch:
 + Food was filling and reasonably priced. The Naan is huge but you do only get 1 piece
+ Mango Lassie was delicious, highly recommend
- Everything is self serve; grabbing plates, silverware, drinks/water, food when it is ready and to-go boxes. Not a huge deal but I was expecting more of a sit down vibe. Definitely not a wine and dine place
author: Isaac A.

description:
come here when you're hungry!

you know, there are places that no matter what ..
is just impossible to hate.

I ordered a chicken biryani with a naan bread (at 6.30 pm).
even though that I haven't eat anything all day, I struggled to finish off the whole plate.
very generous portion, very friendly staff, very convenient location.
my chicken biryani was bland, but considering the total cost, the value and taking everything into consideration I will come here again and again to try their other items in the menu.
very laid back place, and it's very close from home.

PS: chai tea is $1.00 (self serving free refill)
author: Rudy H.

description: Came here based on the good reviews here but was disappointed in my visit. The place was not the cleanest upon entering around 4p (one table was left messy after a patron for at least 15 minutes). The chicken tiki masala was dry (though the sauce is quite good) and the biryani was just of moderate flavor. Also the place had no clean cups available. The place seems popular though.
author: Mikey J.

description: The staff was friendly, and seating was easy to find, though you have to figure it out yourself- no servers even if you choose the dine in option (that was confusing for me at first). The food is good, I got the chicken tikka masala with garlic and onion naan, though not the best Pakistani food I've had.
author: Ran W.

description:
Food and price was decent compared to other Indian restaurants in SF. The restaurant was crowded, but the service speed was reasonable. 

However, near the end of our meal, our party discovered a dead mouse under our table. When we called an employee over, he made an exclamation and just walked away to get someone to clean it. No apology, just an excuse that it must've came from outside. That level of service and hygiene was concerning.
author: Dan L.

description:
The best Pakistani/Indian restaurant in Bay area. Everything over here is very delicious. Authentic recipe and cheaper comparatively to other Paki/Indi locations. The best thing about this location and what them unique is that they use their own spices and hand slaughtered chicken. 
I have tried all of their dishes but these are the best among all:
Lamb Biryani, Chicken and beef seekh kebab, saag paneer, Haleem, Channay and samosa with Chai.
author: Kashif F.

description:
Came here with the sibs for lunch and ordered a lot of food

Got the chicken tikka masala, spinach paneer, chicken biryani and garlic naan.   I got myself a dollar chai as well (but naan and curry offers it for free!!)

Chicken biryani wasnt bad...chicken pieces were a bit chunky but well seasoned and the rice was soft.  

Chicken tikka masala is zesty and more on the tomatoey side than creamy but it was lickety good..a tiny kick

Spinach paneer wasnt too bad...a bit more greasiest than i like

Garlic naan smell very garlicky but didnt taste super garlicky :(

Overall...not bad!
author: Laurie W.

description:
Food was decent but mediocre.  
Service was non-existent.  It's was counter order so I wasn't expecting much but even getting water (never did) and condiments was not without great effort.  I was greeted with "yea" , you know, rather than "hello, can I help you?"  Had the simple order of the beef kabab boti and a piece of naan bread (which i found out was extra after the fact). 
I paid the register and received a number sign for my table with I took with me.  After what felt like forever, I here a guy bellowing from behind the counter "Number 15,  Number 15"   I quickly found out that you are to get up and collect your food rather then it delivered to the table.  What is the point of the table sign then ???
There was no glass of water, that I requested when I ordered, then I discovered there were no utensils or napkins either.  On the way back to my table I notice a station with my missing necessities, including some mostly clean glasses positioned lip down on a wood shelf.  No water in sight and at this point I thought to myself I'm not that thirsty.
Food was on the dry side and when I got to the naan bread I really needed some sort of moister added such as a yogurt or green sauce you often see and these genre of restaurants.  This I could not do without so I got up and after a few minutes of trying to get the attention of the clerk behind the counter, I received a little plastic, lidded, to go cup without any explanation of exactly what it was.  You know the ones you often see at a salsa bar at a taco stand.
Between all that and the fact the place didn't feel very clean and that there were deliveries of overloaded and falling hand trucks coming straight through the front door in the middle of the day.  I won't be going back.
author: John W.

description:
So, the food is good and they got it out to us stupid fast.

The chicken tikka masala was spiced a bit smokier than I've ever had and the palak paneer was a bit oiley. Ordered the naan, got one slice. Really? Seriously? The mango lassi was extremely mango-y but it was stored in a fridge clearly not cold enough. Probably a healthcode violation.


Now why the 1 star? The walls are FILTHY. They clearly don't clean them for months on end. My girlfriend found some sort of date looking thing in her butter chicken that was not tasty. The forks they have for you to grab yourself? Found some water logged spinach in the container.

The prices are good but not worth it when there are other places to eat Indian at all over the bay area. I don't understand why this place is so highly rated except for that maybe they were cleaner in the past. Really, really, gross.
author: Bruce C.

description:
It's divine!!

A lot of our memories are related to their Chana Samosa with fresh cut onions..

They are the best!

Their shawarma varieties are yummy too and they are in such a good location!!
author: Deebs M.

description: Got the achar gosht to go and it was bomb dot com! The spice level was just enough so you could still enjoy the flavors. I love spicy food so beware of ordering if you don't like anything past mild spice. Haha this was a low medium level for me. I ordered a side of garlic naan and it was great paired with the curry. I noticed that they make their naan fresh with an industrial tandoori oven which was pretty cool. I would definitely come back and dine in next time.
author: Malynn T.

description:
We drove into the city to Pakwan on Saturday night so that hubby could get his biryani fix. I don't really expect to find great vegetarian options in a place that is so meat-focused,but I was pleasantly surprised. 

We ordered chicken Biryani (for hubby), Palak aloo (spinach and potatoes), daal (yellow lentils) and Paneer makhani for the kiddo and I to share. We ordered one plain naan and one aloo naan.

Chicken Biryani: 5 (according to the hubby)
Palak aloo: 3.5
Daal: 3
Paneer makhani: 4
Aloo naan: 4

So all in all a good food experience. The place is jam packed and you have to be on the lookout for a table, but service is efficient and servers are helpful. Don't go expecting a fine dining experience...go because you want solid, tasty fare. Definitely a meat lovers dream because their kebabs and Biryani's are on point...but vegetarians won't be disappointed either.
author: Deepa R.

description: Biryani, achar gosht, garlic naan and daal are my staples here. I also like their spinach dishes and tandoori chicken. Highly recommended.
author: Pankaj C.

description:
I'm a huge fan of Indian food so this is saying a lot.

Service: 0/5 - I think that's pretty fair. 
When my boyfriend and I walked into the restaurant, we were not greeted at all. The staff was super rude and shoved a menu at us. When we decided to order and fork up our money, that was the only time I saw a tiny smile... After you order, you basically serve yourself - get your own food, utensils, plates, etc. 

Price: 1/5 - In my opinion, this place is expensive compared to Indian food in Los Angeles. It probably has to do with the high cost of rent, I hope. BUT, if I'm going to serve myself, it's basically considered fast food, so why is it so expensive?? :( 

Food - 1/5 - The flavors just taste off. I'm not sure how to explain it, but it doesn't taste the same as your typical Indian food. We ordered: 
1. Chicken Tikka Masala - 1/5 - How can you mess up on this at an Indian Restaurant? Chicken was kind of dry and the flavor was weird. That ain't good. 
2. Rice - Typical rice. I'm shocked that we had to pay extra for rice. Why doesn't it come with the Tikka Masala?? That doesn't seem right to me. 
3. Bengan Bhartha - 1/5 - I didn't expect it to be like a soup consistency. I thought there would be some chunks of eggplant in there. This dish was way too oily and spicy for me. Probably should give it a 0/5, but it has some flavor, so that's the 1/5. 

Portions look small but they are deceiving. Price is still not cheap compared to LA though. Not coming back. I'm sticking to my Indian food in LA.
author: Sharon H.

description:
Food:  

Daal - I'm not really a fan of vegetables much but this lentil dish is awesome.  Very good flavor and hearty!

Chicken Tikka Masala - A very staple dish and good in flavor.  

Saag Gosht - I'm always a fan of spinach and lamb.  This variation isn't my #1 but I've had in the city but it's still very good.

Garlic Naan - Pretty basic garlic naan but something to help compliment the meal.  

Service: Not a full service joint but more self service in most cases.  The cashier was friendly though.

Ambiance:  It's a very casual place, no frills.  

Overall:  If you want a good hearty AND cheap meal this is the place to go.  I'll be back!
author: Spencer Q.

description: Another favorite. For quick inexpensive Pakistani food. The chicken masala so good as well as the chicken byrani. Make sure you order naan.
author: Princess Jasmine J.

description: I love this restaurant so much! My boyfriend and I come here more than we probably should. He loves trying different items on the menu and had even started eating the food the right way aka using his fingers. This is the best Pakistani food restaurant in the city. I love their weekly specials. They also allow BYOB, which is rare in the city! It's also hard to find nihari in the city, so I am glad they have it on their specials menu often. I have yet to try their weekend halwa poori, but I am sure it is great too given the regular menu is pretty damn amazing! Highly recommend this place for folks craving Desi food.
author: Neda P.

description: Spicy, delicious, Naan!! This place is great if you looking for an affordable Pakistani restaurant that still delivers on quality and taste.  For those who are more familiar with American indian food you can expect more hot spices used.  Make sure to check out their Sunday Buffet!
author: Sa S.

description: The food at this place is authentic and tasty.  I love the Kadai chicken.  I also love their biryanis.  If you order a biryani to go, the portion size is pretty generous.
author: Arjun T.

description: Love Pakwan. The vibe at the restaurant is a special kind of relaxed and the food is great. I think I've had everything on the menu a couple times over, and I keep going back.
author: Adam T.

description: Some of the best indian/pakistani non vegetarian food I've had in the US! We went there on a friday evening, it was busy but this place gets your food out fast, and turns tables pretty quickly so it's usually not too much of a wait. You order at the counter and grab a table, and get the food yourselves. We tried the chicken seekh kabab, tandoori chicken, lamb achari, bhuna gosht and an assortment of naans. The food was spot on delicious, especially loved the kebab and the lamb achari. Reminded me of the food you get in india, simple, unpretentious but simply delicious!
author: Sudipto G.

description: First time in SFO. Looked up for indian places on yelp and this was one of them. The seekh kabab is good but very disappointed with biryani. We ordered a veggie biryani but it tasted like pulao. Don't go for biryani. The bengan ka bhartha is also moderate. I don't know why this place is so hyped up.
author: Grace J.

description:
The equivalent of southern food in the United States: warm, hearty, and filling.

Their biryani is popular, but my favorite is the Achar Gosht, which is a spicy curry with lamb. I usually get this with some samosas and garlic naan, and I am an extremely happy individual.

Everyone that I've convinced to try the achar gosht is blown away. Treat yourself.
author: Jimmy H.

description: I love going here and the food just blows my mind. I tried the paneer makhani, chicken achar and garlic naan. Amazing, fresh food and really good service. I was served by Nidhi at the cashier and was greeted very Kindly.
author: Rajvi S.

description:
Pakwan is definitely a good option to have for a quick, cheap, decent Pakistani/ Indian food. I think it's good for casual weekdays dinner or work lunch or take out. 

I have only tried a couple of dishes so far and I was pretty pleased with what I had ordered. 

The chicken biryani was cooked nicely with big chunks of tender chicken and potatoes. It was flavorful and has a good amount of spice. Huge portion!

The second dish I had was the lamb achar gosht. It was a bit greasy but the lamb was cooked nicely. It was tender, and the curry has a good amount of heat and spice. 

In terms of service, I don't know it well enough since I got my food to go. Don't expect a full dining service as this is a very casual place and it's a self-serve restaurant with no waiters.
author: Sam M.

description:
Very good Indian Pakistani food. I'm not too into spicy food, so I don't eat much Indian. But this place was good. I had a sip of water after every bite. I had chicken Tika masallah. It was better than other places. The mango lassi was good. The naan bread was amazing.

It took a long time to get the food and we were really hungry. Not sure what happened. That's the only reason is not 5 stars.
author: Abu N.

description:
Anytime I'm up in the bay area this is a must to go to spot. In my opinion one of the best Indian restaurants in the world. 
The food is always fresh and unbelievably tasty with just enough spice. Great location and reasonable prices. 
Will definitely return as always.
author: Michael P.

description: Nice found, we ordered chicken saag and lamb chop. Both are great, I love the lamb!!!! Two people our bill is 40 including tips, not bad!
author: Sophie H.

description:
This place is truly a hidden gem! We came here with no expectations, and left completely satisfied. You order at the counter, and water is provided in their self service fridge.

We got the special of the day, which was curry squash ($7.99), naan ($.150), sang paneer (I believe it was $8.99), and somosas ($3.99). I must say everything was absolutely amazing! The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because it was too oily, however, it was very delicious.

I cannot wait to come back!!!
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: Self service, decent naans and curries for the price. Wouldn't recommend the veg pakora appetizer.
author: Krishna K.

description:
This place is incredible. I went with 4 friends and our eyes were bigger than our stomachs -- we ordered the veggie pakoras, samosas, garlic and plain naan (their huge and delicious), chicken tikka masala, paneer makhani and chana masala. Everything was amazing and we left with some leftovers which made for the best dinner the next day. 

One thing to note: they do not sell alcohol but it did appear as though folks knew to bring in their own beer. Smart cookies. 

As for the feel, at first glance, the restaurant feels like a fast food joint but after you sit down and are served your food, it feels much more homey and comfortable. There may be folks standing and hovering by your table only because it can get crowded at peak dinner time.
author: Lucy C.

description:
Whoa. Really flavorful food with great portions. I like it.

I suggest ordering take-out if you want to have a nice sit-down meal, otherwise you'll have to wait or eat on a bench outside because this place tends to be very packed at all times (it's a block from the 16th st bart station). 

I ordered a keema naan (stuffed beef), a garlic naan, a saag gosht (tender lamb and spinach), and chicken tikki masala to share with one other person--this was more than enough food since their portions sizes are pretty big.

While the meats were a little dry and tough, and the curries submerged in a layer of oil, the entire thing was well-spiced AND spicy. Flavor nation. Definitely more on the rich/savory side so I was glad to have my naan to compliment it. 

The beef naan is amazing. Theres a flat beef patty thing inside exploding with spices--very dynamic flavor that isn't overpowering. Garlic naan a little overbaked, not too mind-blowing, but a good portion size with fluffy breading--definitely not a store-brought pita which I appreciate.
author: Lydia Z.

description:
It must've went downhill. I ate here a few years ago and I loved it, so I recently came back to get the chicken tiki masala again and I wasn't amazed anymore.
The portion was decent sized and it's a self serve place (you order then you sit). As for the food.. I've definitely had way better masala elsewhere so I won't be coming back.
author: Julian Y.

description: I been coming here for years and I can say that u don't get what u paid for, u get more. Rich taste and inexpensive. Here's a quick snap of my order. lamb biryani, chicken tandoori, chicken masala and garlic naan.
author: rob a.

description:
We ordered Saag Chicken, Rice and Naag today for lunch delivery with Postmates.  When the order came, the naan was sitting on top of the food with parchment paper in between, but there was oil and liquids soaking through the parchment paper so it was really messy.  I don't know why they don't put the naan in a different bag and get better containers for togo, or make sure food isn't leaking when it's sent out.  

Food was decent, not great.  Delivery experience was poor and messy.  We'll likely look for other options for our Indian food needs.
author: Vi Y.

description:
This is literally the best no-frills place in the world and should be a staple in the takeout/casual dining rotation for everyone in the area. The food is amazing and incredibly cheap. It's BYOB. It's always packed with people. You can get it to go or stay in and bring a bottle! 

We love this place because it's only slightly more expensive than cooking at home and way more delicious than we could ever make! Also sometimes when we make Indian food we'll still come here to get naan to go along with it. 

Favorite dish by far is the Aloo Palak. The rice biyarni dishes are also nice as well and are HUGE. I also like chicken masala and the eggplant. Basically, can't go wrong here. Oh and garlic naan of course!
author: Sarah D.

description:
Food poisoning!!!!!' I've ordered from Pakwan a number of times and their food is OK... 3/5,  their tandoori chicken is actually pretty good 4/5...

The reason I'm giving pakwan 1 star is because a few nights ago, I ordered saag paneer and rice as a takeout.. I came home, I ate the food (it was still hot out of the container) and  I had the most violent food poisoning I have ever had in my life. Lasted about 36 hours. How do you get FP with hot vegetarian food? Their freshness of ingredients is questionable...
author: Reena T.

description:
Pretty good goat biryani and chicken karahi. Meat was cooked well in both dishes. Garlic naan was a bit dough-y. 

Closer to 3.5 than 3 stars.
author: Harsha K.

description:
Ordered the Chicken Tikka Marsala here. I like to think of myself as a CTM specialist, having tried the same dish at hundreds of restaurants around the world. For what that's worth, I found the dish here to be underwhelming. The meat was a bit dry, the sauce was a bit on the darker side (needing more cream), and not sufficiently sweet. With that said, the dish had the right amount of spiciness. Overall, had the meat been more tender, it may have been an acceptable dish. 

The naan was amazing. Warm, fluffy and crunchy at the same time. I eventually gave up on the meat and had the naan with the CTM sauce. That was much more satisfying. 

If you're really craving CTM and there's no other places close by, it's not a terrible choice. My recommendation: take a Lyft to a better spot.
author: Behnam S.

description: Best Indian food I ever had in bay area. Really amazing food, I really enjoyed my Sunday morning here. Will be back soon whenever I come to bay area.
author: Lovepreet T.

description:
Place just isn't that good.  The chicken is dry in the butter chicken.  The sauce in the tikka masala is just off and I've tried curry twice and been underwhelmed.

Not sure why this place has so many stars I've gone now 4 times and still get the same mediocre Indian/Pakistani food.  For someone new to the area understand my level of frustration.
author: Branden W.

description:
It seems like lots of people take food to go here. I'm always conflicted- do I want to dine in and let the smells seep into my hair and clothes, or do I take it home and let the smells permeate the entire apartment? If you dine in, it's mostly self serve. Order at the counter, take a number, and they call it out/flash it on the TV screen when your food is ready. For some reason, they brought my lamb biryani to me- maybe because it was such a mountainous portion that they didn't think I could carry the plate? It's legit big enough to feed me for THREE WHOLE MEALS. 

The lamb biryani is BOMB. The meat is sooooo tender, and the rice is flavorful AF. There are sauces you can use to take down the heat, (sorry, I don't know the names- a green yogurt and a brown tangy sauce), but I don't think the dish is that spicy. 

My friend ordered the onion naan and chicken tikka masala, which I got to try- both great. Rice must be ordered separately. There wasn't much chicken, but I guess they gotta find ways to afford rent somehow.
author: Karen S.

description: I was with my family around the mission district when I saw pakwan on yelp and they had pretty good reviews so we swung by! We got the lamb curry and goat curry and it was amazing!! But note that you have to get your own utensils and plates and the plates we got were somewhat dirty so u gotta watch out.
author: Samantha C.

description: I would give this one 3 stars.  I was given advice on several occasions to try this place based on the authenticity of the dishes.  I have tried 3 dishes, saag paneer, chicken saag, and chicken saag without dairy.  This was by far the strangest I have ever eaten, and I am very fond of Indian foods.  The dishes had full size star anise throughout, the chicken dishes contained full size chicken pieces with bones, and other spices were in the dishes (not sure what they were).  Now, if this is truly authentic, then it was great.  I found the dishes difficult to eat around the full size spices and picking bones.
author: Kelly C.

description:
This is such a good find! I had the Chicken Boti Kababs and Garlic Naan (pictured) and it tasted just like how it would back home in India at some of my favourite spots. 

I'm taking one star away because their restroom was in really bad shape -- quite unclean and slippery. Apart from this one detail, this is a great place to get some Pakistani / Indian food.
author: Gouthaman K.

description: Here is a tip: the best kept secret at Pakwan is the GOAT CURRY which they do every week or two at some odd day whenever they like (I call thrice a week to find out) and the Keema Aalu (mince meat with potatoes). Lamb is fine - goat is the real deal! with crispy naan, or rice, if you like the taste of good meat....its another level...
author: Babar Y.

description:
The environment is chaotic, and this place can be more operationally efficient.

Pakwan was REALLY busy on a Friday night. You order at the counter and find a table to sit at. No table fo yoo? Tough luck, buddy. They call your number for you to pick up food. Yet, when the restaurant is rowdy, it's hard to hear things. So people end up hovering around the pick-up counter. Cramped much?

But it's crowded for a reason, eh? (Yes, I have turned Canadian for this review). The chicken biriyani is a popular dish, as is the saag paneer. Their dishes definitely have some spice. Tasty food!
author: Joanna L.

description: I've been craving Chicken Tikka Masala for weeks and today my craving was satisfied. Super delicious. I also got a side of garlic naan which was also fresh out and still hot. The ambiance felt authentic, they had pakistanian music playing which really made it feel that way.. They have self serve water which u take to your table. I loved it!
author: Liset O.

description: One of my go-to spots for typical Indian/Pakistani cuisine.  Ample seating, quick ordering, food served hot to your table via number. Drink/soda options. I always get something along the lines of Chicken Tikka Masala or Butter Chicken, my all time favorites. Paired with some basmati rice and/or garlic naan. Mouth is watering just writing about it. Portions are generous and you'll be content after. As a big fan of North Indian cuisine, you can tell how each restaurant cooks their curries/gravies/meats/tandoori/etc differently. These guys are efficient and above average quality.
author: Alan G.

description:
Very good food, the best. Place not fancy,  but the food delicious. Price okay 
Employees just okay. 

I definitely recommend this place if you like Indian or Pakistanian food. Yamiiiiii
author: Nadia H.

description: Food was ok, restaurant was not very clean but acceptable, and service was ok. Not the best food I've had, but it's alright .
author: Mikes K.

description:
I posted this review a few days ago for a different location. Fixing my mistake.
--------3 stars- Made a quick stop to pick up Tandoori chicken (boti). Didn't realize it was a self service place. This review is only for the food I picked up- The chicken was just okay. It did not seem like the chicken was marinated for long enough as the flavors did not seep in to the chicken. I will have to try other dishes to see if my opinion about the food changes.

Appending my latest review to the old one-
Came back to eat in. Ordered goat curry, garlic naan, tandoori leg and spinach daal. Everything was pretty good. Changing my rating to 4 stars. The food was flavorful, it had raw spices which were distinct for each dish, so every dish did not taste the same. Naan was pretty damn good. If you can overlook the hygiene of the place(try not using the restrooms here), the food tastes pretty good.
author: Chet L.

description: This place was amazing and the service was top notch. The biryani was the best I've had since Singapore, and the naan was phenomenal. Better than all the restaurants in Sacramento and I can't wait to go back.
author: Tamer M.

description: As an Indian person, this is my go-to spot! The service is fast, prices are good and you can byob. I highly recommend the eggplant, saag daal and briyani. Shout out to the staff for being super friendly - one time they forgot something in my order and I called them up, they let me pick it up the next day and gave me some extra treats for my trouble, which was really sweet of them.
author: Supreet C.

description: Best Indian food in town, and cheap! BYOB if you eat in and really quick service for take out.
author: Savannah D.

description: Pakwan is on my regular rotation because it's freaking delish and very reasonably priced. I admit, I basic, so I always get the butter chicken (chicken makhanwala). It's so good, I can't not order it every time I go. Plus it feeds me twice because the helping is generous (1 chk, 2 naan= lunch and dinner). My roomie usually gets a lamb dish that I can't remember the name. The curry is great but I'm simply not a fan of lamb. We've also tried kebabs which are tasty but then you miss the sauce. The garlic naan makes my mouth water. Plenty of seating and they are very lax on the bring your own drink policy :)))  by far my favorite Indian food joint in the city.
author: Joana Z.

description:
Why is this place so packed on a daily basis? Even the pick up line is crazy.

If you are looking for good portioned indian food, this would probably go on top of my list, the lamb chops tandoori is no joke, larger cuts of meat, tender and smoked tandoori flavor

The chicken achar curry was heavy, spicy full flavored

the chicken tikka masala was standard, thick cuts of chicken meat, heavy sauce, flavorful and the cuts of chicken was not dry, perfect for dipping naan

the lamb bryani was also good, oddly potatoes was added to this dish which I didn't care for, more potatoes in this dish then meant less rice or meat, good flavor again would have been better without the potatoes

The garlic naan - subtle not thick, light airy, perfect for dipping or wrapping meat

If your looking to feed more then 2 people what I ordered was meant for 4-5 people but thats how I roll, just to insure I get leftovers for the next day haha

If you are in the area I do recommend the food it is tasty and spicy, for me it was mid spicy but most folks that don't like spice will say it is too spicy haha just heads up

Again the line here is always long, place to go, separate line for togo orders, form lone on right for pick up

Food **** heavy, spicy, portion are bigger then most indian places I have eaten
Price $$
Service **** they talk fast, serve fast, don't be upset if they can't spell your name correctly
Ambiance *** slightly dark, dark reddish walls, neon boards for specials, tables consist of 2 seater and 4 seaters
author: Clarence A.

description:
Food was okay, price was okay. The bathroom: heart-wrenching horrible. I went to the bathroom to wash my hands before eating and I lost my appetite  .. nope, not going back. 
I know previous posts had warned about the hygiene of the workers along with the disgusting kitchen. I ignored it and was really craving some Indian food. Uhm whoops. We'll try another place next time. 
It was a good experience of a different kind of cultures food though. They have Bollywood playing on tv too
author: Janine P.

description:
Indian food is usually heavy on the stomach...and it is, but you know Pakwan does Indian food the right way when you come in full from eating a crappy subpar Indian buffet for lunch only to take a waft of their glorious fragrances that come out of their kitchen and you start salivating. That is the Pakwan effect. 

When my cousin suggested Indian food for dinner, I was reluctant, but chose to go because I hadn't caught up with in a while. Everything I ordered, from Garlic Naan to their biryanis to their Palak Paneer and Chicken Tikka Masala can only by described as "culinary excellence." I grew up eating my friend's mom's Indian cuisine, so I have an acquired palette. Pakwan hits the spot every time like her cooking, but they have access to a Tandoor.

Pakwan = Best Indian Restaurant in SF!
author: Brian L.

description:
I was disappointed with the food quality and ambience. I tried vegetarian menu. The food is poor to average in quality and taste. It's cheap in terms of prices. That might explain the good reviews.

The current reviews gave me a wrong impression about the place. I don't think I'll eat here again.
author: Rakesh G.

description: Really good, affordable Indian food. This is a super casual, no frills place. There is no waiter/waitress service. You stand in line to order and they call you when the order is up to grab your food. The place was pretty crowded when we got there, but we were able to snag a table. Our food was made pretty quickly. The interior atmosphere is also super simple and no frills. Would definitely go back, but also think this would be the perfect place to order take out from since you really aren't missing anything if you don't sit in the place itself.
author: Alissa T.

description: I really, really like this place! I'm not that fancy when it comes to Indian food, but have had some amazing stuff from all over the world (including Singapore and Thailand). This place hits the spot whenever I'm craving Indian food, pick-up is really easy, and it's my go-to spot in the Mission.
author: Ryan S.

description: Casual restaurant with outstanding food. It's a self serve style restaurant so you won't be waited on. The food is fairly priced and very filling. I recommend the tandoori chicken!
author: Lyndon G.

description:
Solid in every respect - quick, cheap, and tasty. 

Very very popular place and constantly busy. Always a good sign.

Not the most delicious of Indian food as it is quite productionized, but it's worthy of the 4 stars. Was disappointing that the same chicken (huge chunks of white meat) are lobbed into the biryani as a good biryani is really best with some darker meat, even better with meat on the bone. Those same chunks are used for the chicken achar, tikka masala etc - so you can see the beginnings of their productionization.

Will keep coming back here as it is just as described above - quick, cheap, and tasty!
author: David J.

description:
I tried this spot out on my firat night in SF. We were in the mood to try something new and this place seemed pretty popular.

Everything is made fresh to order and you can taste it in their dishes. We tried the Tikka Masala, Butter Chicken, Basmati Rice, and Garlic Naan Bread. All the dishes were flavorful and people complained about the portion sizes but I thought it was good. 8 was stuffed and didn't even finish my plate.

The staff aren't the friendliest but I think it may just be a cultural difference.
author: Kristian G.

description:
My new favorite date night spot! My hubby and I walked by Pakwan on a Friday night and saw the place poppin' out of control. Is this a club? Where are the bouncers? 

We decided to check out the hype. Walking in, we realized this is more of a homey, hole-in-the-wall Pakistani restaurant, and saw tables packed with people laughing, drinking, having a great time. I'm definitely feeling the place at this point. But then we noticed varieties of empty wine/beer bottles, dare this place be... BYOB?! Now THIS... is my kind of place. With no more hesitation, we put in our orders of garlic naan (puffy and delicious), extra spicy lamb curry (yum, so flavorful), vegetable biryani (HUGE portions), and tandoori chicken and got rung up all for less than $40. An extraordinarily reasonable price for a place in such a good location in the Mission. We went straight to the liquor store across the street after putting in our orders, and came back to the restaurant ready to eat and ready to booze. Food ended up being so delicious, we even had leftovers to take home. So glad we came in on a whim -- this place is a gem!
author: Cathy C.

description: The most amazing Indian food in the Bay Area. It's inexpensive and there are vegan options! Ask the girl at the counter and she will help you out! Super traditional and delicious
author: Auvianna T.

description:
Another Indian/Pakistani place tried but still not good enough when compared against to my favorite Indian/Pakistani place, Shalimar.  Every time I yelp an Indian place, I always have to mention Shalimar because the bar has been set really high.  Every Indian restaurant business owner will hate reading my review because of the constant name dropping of their competitor ...that is until a restaurant proves me wrong.

Got the garlic naan (too dry) and the chicken curry achar (not spicy enough).  Cheap and the food is decent at best.  Service is nothing to be expected from places like these.  This place is comparable to Naan N Curry to me, which is a probably an insult to most Indian restaurants.
author: Bailey N.

description:
Lamb biryani, hands down is one of the best I've had. Garlic naan is meh. Not flavorful, or garlicky. We ordered two tandoori chickens, since our family is big, but one of them were dry. "Riata" is really good but the "imili sauce" isn't.

Was not crazy for the restroom. As busy the restaurant is, they can afford to remodel the restroom.
author: Farah A.

description:
On separate occasions, I had friends say that this is their "go-to" in the Mission and I can definitely see why. 

[GOOD TIPS] 
- BYOB (Bring your own Booze!) YAS! ... across the street is a liquor store that you can make a quick stop at. (; or a good substitute to an adult beverage is their masala tea, which is delicious!
- Save a table! See an open one? Grab it right away! The restaurant can get busy quick.

Do not be noob. Be sure to order from the counter and take your number to the table and it's self-service. Your number will appear on the television (located in the corner of the restaurant). Pick up your utensils, plates, and napkins, near the counter. 

For two people: 
2 Main Dishes + the Must Have (1 rice dish OR (2) naan bread... or BOTH if you're a hangry person) 
*Chicken Tikka Masala: Just Classic
*Achar Gosht: I could handle only certain spicy dishes, and this was one of them! The lamb meat was tender.
*Saag Paneer: Saag is a good compliment to any spicy dish and calms down my tongue. I wish it had more cheese chunks. 
*Naan bread: Can be a hit or miss. Had one burnt one, but the other one was perfect.
*Rice dish: Also a good compliment to any spicy dish. 

I'll be back again! :)
author: Casie C.

description:
Food: Okay but not consistent
Service: Meh (it's self-serve)
Cleanliness: Terrible - the lack of hygiene is appalling

All in all this place is not value for money. It's more expensive than most Indian/Pakistani restaurants in the SF Bay area. My main beef with them is the lack of consistency - on a good day, they'll serve biryani that's a treat for the gods but the very next day it'll be so bad that you'll gag when you smell it.

Keep an eye on the check - some of the cashiers here are sneaky and will try to fleece you. On two occasions I was billed excessively and only found out after I requested an itemized receipt. Pro- tip: Avoid the restrooms like the plague - there are thriving ecosystems within, which might possibly interest a bacteriologis but are not for the faint hearted
author: Sudeep K.

description: Everything is good here, though when they say "Yes, we can make it mild" they are using The Karachi Scale.  A really raucous place when crowded, this Pakwan location has a different clientele than Pakwan in Fremont (where almost all the diners are Moslem and many are wearing the shalwar kamiz of Pakistan).  But the menu and quality are just as terrific.
author: Matt B.

description: I've walked past this place a thousand times, but I went in there for the first time tonight, and - wow!! This place is awesome! We all ordered different dishes, and they were all delicious. Bam! Go there now!
author: Stalag T.

description: I have just found this little gem on Thursday night! And let me tell you...I was very pleased!! The food was amazing! The chicken tikka was so good and so was the boneless Tandoori (idk the menu name, sorry). It was so busy, I was super surprised! We did have to wait a little while for our food, to the point I thought they lost our order BUTTTT I'm assuming it was because of how slammed they were. One of the gentlemen working there was very nice, unfortunately I did not get his name. It's a self service kind of place. You get your own water and plates and what not. The menus are by the registers. You pay then sit to eat. (I'm just giving all details because I was so confused when I arrived lol). Overall, delicious food, you just have to be patient. Pricing was good too. Will definitely be my go to!! Enjoy!
author: Sabrina S.

description: I would recommend chicken tikka masala but wouldn't normally endorse buying chicken saag. Incredible ambiance and food is amazing. Service was a tiny bit poor.
author: Brenda L.

description: Yep, this place is one of the more delicious Indian and Pakistani places in the Bay Area. My South Asian husband and I totally will go out of our way to go here. And he is picky about what Indian restaurants he likes! Not fancy atmosphere like Dosa or anything, but for a casual place to eat delicious food, Pakwan is great.
author: katie s.

description:
You can't beat Pakwan. BYOB and super hospitable, delicious and affordable. Grab a vase of water, a table and enjoy the delicious Indian food.

Can't go wrong with any of the entrees, but just remember you have to order rice separately as well ($1). Shared the chana masala, the chicken tikka masala and the veggie potato dish. All of the dishes were an easy 5-stars. We sat outside and enjoyed the atmosphere of the Mission.

Pakwan is a no-frills Indian spot with delicious food. Order at the counter, grab a table and enjoy. The mango lassi is delicious as well if you're looking for a drink. Great place to take a bottle of wine, sit outside (a lot quieter) and unwind.
author: Alex L.

description: Daal, amazing. Naan, spectacular, Chana masala, exquisite. Music, fire. This place is truly delicious. Have told so many friends, family, and visitors of SF to try. My boyfriend and I both agree this is the best Indian food we've ever had. Not to mention the friendly and smiling service!
author: Chloe G.

description: Beef nihari is no longer a speciality item. Now it's on daily menu. Just had it again yesterday... it's awesome!!
author: Atif R.

description:
Based on the good yelp reviews ordered the following via Amazon: 
Daal: pretty descent and tasty. 
Lamb chops and ground beef kabob: WAY TOO SALTY; couldn't taste any other flavors but salt. Tasted as if one cook added salt, and the the 2nd cook added salt, not know the food already was salted.
author: Monica R B.

description: The most amazing chicken biryani ever!! I'm a very picky meat eater, but they use only breast chunks, and put tons of it! The yummiest part is the caramelized onions, and the free sauces they have available in the mini fridges. The mango lassi is very refreshing and tastes like a straight up fresh mango. Very chill vibe, cool + casual atmosphere!
author: Hōkū Y.

description: Exploring the City night culture and you find yourself hungry, where do you go? Pakwan! BYOB and indulge in some great food!
author: Hemant J.

description:
It is tough to find a parking but the food is so good it is worth the hassle.
Prices are very reasonable and the food is so good.
I love the Naan bread all the varieties.
Chicken tikka is so good. Channa Masala with the vegetable biriani is so good.
Chicken Tikka Masala is another great option.
You can close your eyes and pick anything and it will be great.
The only issue I have with this place is the cleanliness. It is never maintained well. Table are dirty. We had to wipe our tables almost every time we went there.
Bathrooms don't use unless you have to. They are disgusting.
I still go there because if how good the food is .
author: Samer E.

description: Good indian food. Portion sizes are good. Biryani is flavorful and not so spicy. Naan, curries are good too.
author: Meera S.

description:
FLUFFIEST NAAN EVER.

Seriously, this garlic naan haunts my dreams in a wonderful way. 

So you have less than ten dollars, you want quality Indian food, and you're in the Mission. What do you do? Go to Pakwan. This place has that hole in the wall/cafeteria vibe with all the bars you want nearby. 

The eggplant, paneer, basmati rice, and naan are my favorite combination. My cousin and I can be full for $25. Unreal. And the options that Pakwan has to offer are wonderful. He's a vegetarian while I'm a meat eater so it was nice to be able to go to a place where both of us can be completely happy and not feel like we're missing out on anything. 

I moved to NYC recently yet I still think that Pakwan remains to be one of my favorite Indian places -- and there's a lot of great places out here. Between the value, portion size, casual vibes, and of course, delicious food; Pakwan is a top choice.

BUT remember: whatever you get, the naan is the perfect vehicle to deliver it.
author: Kathryn T.

description: The lamb biryani & garlic naan are my favs! The biryani plates are HUGE & definitely shareable. Workers are also friendly.
author: Angelica Y.

description:
3.5 stars

I got the butter chicken. Which I love. I mean, butter. And chicken. Actually, TBH, I don't know if there's actually any butter in it.

You order at the counter and they bring it to your table. I got a naan with it as well and it was a decent meal. The naan was good. The butter chicken was pretty good, but it was kind of sweet. Not sure if that's how it's suppose to be, but I've had others and it was more on the salty and spicy side which I like. The chicken itself was alright.

Overall, it was alright.
author: Sophia Y.

description: This place is so amazing! Coming from an Indian, I'd say the flavors are very authentic and delicious! Have had the pleasure of trying almost everything on the menu and I am impressed! The staff is also so nice and the food comes out quick! Lamb saag is my favorite and the biryani! The garlic naan is perfect!
author: Dhrithi N.

description: Not great ambiance but a perfect one for tasty Pakistani/ Indian food for very reasonable money. Food was so great that I visited Pakwan the same week again despite it being far from where I stay. Go for Chicken Tikka Masala / Karachi Chicken. Gulabjamun as desert is great. You can bring your own booze to the place and enjoy the south Asian food :)
author: Tanvi P.

description:
Definitely a place to go when you're feeling like some cheap, decent Indian food. Dingy place, but who cares, because you're definitely not paying for the ambience or the service! Another plus is that it's BYOB. Casual.

We got the paneer makhani (butter paneer) and saag paneer, with garlic naan and basmati rice. Also tried the mango lassi, which was sweet and yummy. I was a bit disappointed with the naan in this visit. It wasn't fluffy enough, and even got hard/crunchy/burnt in some parts, which was disappointing because I like my naan fluffy and soft. The butter paneer was a bowl of buttery goodnessss, if you can get past how unhealthy it is. I think the portions may have gotten smaller than the last time I got here, but I guess it's good because overeating is never a good thing?! The saag paneer paled in comparison though. I wasn't that into the flavor. I'm not sure if I just came on a bad day, or maybe my taste buds have gotten pickier about quality?! Because I remember the food being better in the past, though it's been a year since I'd last gone.

tl;dr Cheap, decent hole-in-the-wall Indian food. BYOB!
author: Grace D.

description:
G-double-O-D, good, GOOD. 

Our go-to for no-frills, affordable Indian and Pakistani food that is just down right gratifying. And BYOB! So be sure to crack open a cold one, or pour some of that cougar juice. If you completely forget to bring your bottles, don't fret, K & D Market is right across the street. 

Everything is self-service, so don't expect any customer service. You merely order and pay at the register, and pick up your food at the counter when it's ready. Grab your own plates, utensils, water, blah, blah...so what? Shieet, the food is delicious and the prices are great. 

RECOMMENDATIONS 
For our mains, we always opt for the flavorful, oh so aromatic bhuna and chicken tikka masala. Meat is tender and moist.The saag paneer is really tasty as a side dish, but it's best you share this as a group, because I feel that it's too large of a portion for just two people. We've also tried the spicy chicken biryani (serving for three people), but it's definitely carb overload when you already have their yummy warm nan on the side. I recommend asking for yogurt on the side, to eat with your basmati rice. Also, grab the two sauces from the fridge area and use them. 

+ Casual ambiance, great for groups
+ BYOB
+ Self-service 
+ Pakwan vs Shalimar? Pakwan ftw.
author: Merica S.

description: We had the chicken byrani (best eats 7x7 list) and was very disappointed. The chicken was so dry. Also had the chicken tikka masala and naan. The naan was also a bit dry. I would not come back to this place given then so many other indian food options in the city.
author: Jenny L.

description: My husband and I love to eat here when we are in the area! nice proportions and tasty food for the price
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Your typical Indian joint --- tables placed within elbow reach. Food ordered at the counter and served at your table. Ordered Day's special - Goat Biryani and Onion Nan!

Biryani was spiced Rice base with the meat tossed on top! Nan was cold and soggy!!

NOT A Fan!
author: Madhusudhan R.

description:
Wonderful food. The biryani was very flavorful and not spicy at all. Was made just right . The chola murgh was very tasty! 
Perfect food
author: John S.

description: Authentic, delicious, moderately priced. They don't deliver, so you have to use an alternative delivery service like Postmates if you wanna order in.
author: Kaveh M.

description: The food here is SO GOOD. I came here for dinner the other night and my heart melted. Some of the best flaky naan I've ever had. I ordered the chicken tikka masala and the chicken was soooo tender, it melted in my mouth like a warm marshmallow. It was spicy, but that's okay. I love the vibe in here too. Definitely will return.
author: Tilly D.

description: Yum! The beef kabob is excellent. Also BYOB which is great! Will be back for sure. The garlic nann is also delicious and they give you a lot of it!
author: Rob M.

description:
Not sure why this place has an average 4 star rating with over a thousand reviews. 
Living in Chicago, I heard a lot that San Fran has some good Indian/Pakistani/Desi food from more than 20 people, I was looking forward to enjoy that one meal I had assigned for Desi food for my vacation here. And ...was highly disappointed.
Food was just ok. Garlic naan was very dry and hard, and the entrees (we almost ordered everything on their menu since we were a big group and excited). Some items were missing the most basic flavors. 
The place is self service, which We didn't mind, but the plates, spoons, the entire dining area and bathrooms were dirty. Again We would have ignored that bringing out our most positive sides provided we received some good food.. But We didn't. 
Anyways, if you would like to check this place out please do not have high expectations or go there drunk.
author: Kunal C.

description: The best North Indian I've had in a long time!! We got lamb gosht, chicken achari, onion naan, beef keema naan and chicken biryani! The naans were extremely flavorful.. right amount of masala and so fluffy!! The biryani had cilantro and fried onions.. can't go wrong with that! The beef was seasoned well and tender. The only downside was the food was oily!
author: Madhunisha M.

description: One of my top three go to/no fuss places to eat for over ten years. Chicken is amazing, rice is fluffy and bread is A++. Basic and satisfying.
author: Rheal G.

description:
Pakwan was recommended to me by a friend who lives in the area so I thought I'd give it a try. I really wish I had liked it more as it's so convenient but I probably won't eat here again as my favourite Indian dishes weren't the best here. 

I ordered the butter chicken, saag paneer, naan, raita and the rice. Butter chicken - really doesn't taste anything like butter chicken so I do not recommend anyone order this - maybe go with the Chicken Tikka instead. Saag paneer - this was actually good and I'd eat it again but be warned, it's much oilier than normal Saag Paneer. The naan and the rice were good (bit hard to mess those up) and the raita was on the sweet side but still good. I am Indian so I have eaten a lot of Indian food, my standards are quite high so if you're looking for mediocre & quick Indian food, eat here but if you want awesome Indian food, go somewhere else.
author: Mira B.

description: Pakwan is a hole-in-the-wall, self-service Pakistani/Indian restaurant that serves food on the cheap; three friends and I came for dinner and split a few dishes from throughout the menu. The chicken tikka masala came with white meat chicken, which came out somewhat dry, and the curry wasn't particularly heavily spiced. The tandoori chicken leg and goat biryani were nice, but perhaps nothing to write home about. We also had garlic naan and the naan stuffed with ground beef on the side, but both of them seemed a little bit dry and not all too fresh. Overall not the best Indian/Pakistani I've had; I'd recommend DOSA down the street, which was a lot sharper on their flavors.
author: David K.

description:
Pakwan gets pretty busy most nights. It is a sit-down place, but you order at the counter and wait for them to call your number. You also have to get extra plates, utensils, cups, etc. yourself. It's BYOB though! I always see plenty of groups drinking beer or splitting a bottle of wine.

My standard order is basmatic rice, chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, tandoori lamb chops, and garlic naan. So delicious!!! You cannot go wrong with the chicken tikka masala or saag panner. The lamb chops are tender and a bit on the salty side, but go really well with the grilled onions that come with it. My craving for Indian food is always satisfied when I come here!
author: Tiffany P.

description: I have been coming here for YEARS! And while the staff and cooks seem to come and go, the experience - and the food - are always top notch! Try the tandoori lamb chops. They are they ONLY lamb chops I've ever liked.
author: Agent R.

description:
My go to place for not-totally-authentic-but-good Indian food. They deliver too (and usually within 40 min) which is awesome.

Favorites:

1. Chicken Tikka masala - deliciously creamy, not spicy enough though 
2. Seekh kebab - i prefer lamb usually but this one is made of beef and pretty good 
3. Garlic naan - ask for them to add butter ;)

Great spot to try in person also. It's self seating and a BYO too!

Definitely recommend it!
author: Farid V.

description: Loved it a few years ago but the food and service were poor the night we were there. It was cold inside, tables were not cleaned, bathroom floor was VERY slippery. We had some standard dishes: chicken tikka masala, chana masala, garlic naan (this was the only good piece of the meal) and rice.
